Articles.Content:
Since the Crash last week, iam back flying, started a fresh, (NO Saves) but i'v noticed the Yellow fuel lines dont work when trying to firer all 3 engines but using  fuel ONLY from 2 tanks.  So my question is would you guys use mechjeb or module manager, are these safe to down-load, i really need the docking camera, what are you guys using. and whats safe.  I have noticed on load up it says 1.3 and it is from STEAM  does this make any difference.  Thanks in advance.

Brian
From what think, Module Manager is updated for 1.3. But there is no stabl release for MechJeb though. The Steam and store version do not affect gameplay.
ok thanks were can i get  an up graded Module manager from..?? cant remember were i got the original>>

The fuel pipes are one-way devices.  You know that, right?  They'll transfer from the first tank you attached to, to the second one, but not the other way.  I'm not sure what you're trying to do with running three engines from two tanks, however -- can you post a screen shot of the vessel?

8 hours ago, capt: scarlet said:

ok thanks were can i get  an up graded Module manager from..?? cant remember were i got the original>>

 

All mod related stuff starts here.

8 hours ago, Zeiss Ikon said:

The fuel pipes are one-way devices.  You know that, right?  They'll transfer from the first tank you attached to, to the second one, but not the other way.  I'm not sure what you're trying to do with running three engines from two tanks, however -- can you post a screen shot of the vessel?

 

Iv been flying to Mun Minmuss and the red planet, it was all working fine till last week, I have 3 identical rockets, the main has a swivel engine with the other two on the sides are none swivel, fuel from left tank to main, same for the right tank, works fine, even with four as shown by Scott Manley, even my docking camera Iv had to delete, to make KSP work. i would love to show you my set up but dont no how to attach pics.  Doh!!

13 minutes ago, capt: scarlet said:

but dont no how to attach pics.  Doh!! 

Ah. Pics are helpful. Quick guide - take a screenshot with F1 and an image is saved to your screenshot folder. Then use an image sharing website like imgur to upload those images to the internet. Then use the BBCode link, or directly link the picture and it should be embedded. By directly link, I mean use the one that ends in .jpg or .png or something similar.

As for a docking camera, try maybe hullcam. It puts a camera in the docking ports. Don't know if its updated to 1.3 though.

1 hour ago, qzgy said:

Ah. Pics are helpful. Quick guide - take a screenshot with F1 and an image is saved to your screenshot folder. Then use an image sharing website like imgur to upload those images to the internet. Then use the BBCode link, or directly link the picture and it should be embedded. By directly link, I mean use the one that ends in .jpg or .png or something similar.

As for a docking camera, try maybe hullcam. It puts a camera in the docking ports. Don't know if its updated to 1.3 though.

many thanks on the Hullcam i'll give that a look, as for the pics upload seem like hassle to me Not IT LIT/ lol

There is a stable release of MechJeb.

https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/
Modding question moved to the modding subforum.

13 hours ago, capt: scarlet said:

Iv been flying to Mun Minmuss and the red planet, it was all working fine till last week, I have 3 identical rockets, the main has a swivel engine with the other two on the sides are none swivel, fuel from left tank to main, same for the right tank, works fine, even with four as shown by Scott Manley, even my docking camera Iv had to delete, to make KSP work. i would love to show you my set up but dont no how to attach pics.  Doh!! 

Okay, what this setup should do is let you run the outboard tanks dry and finish with the center tank full (though it won't show that way on the bars in the staging display until you stage off the side boosters).  If it's not doing that, something may have accidentally gotten changed in your flow priority settings -- or you may have a bug in your KSP (either the stock or one of your mods might do it, especially if your KSP got upgraded to 1.3 and you have a mod that's not fully compatible with that version).

On 6/4/2017 at 3:43 PM, Mike Mars said:

There is a stable release of MechJeb.

https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/

That's not a stable release. That's the dev release.

And there was a stable release of MJ a week ago...
